Description: Gypsum alabastron; three lug handles on shoulder; convex base; tall neck with slightly flaring rim; formed through both carving and grinding with an abrasive; surface corroded.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Curator's comments: A note in the vessel stating that the Excavation Notebooks assign the object to Tomb 94 but that Tomb 94 is in Cyprus Museum - CM A.208 is said to be from this tomb - so no Tomb 94 objects should be in British Museum. See Bevan 2007 passim for an overview and typological guide to stone vessels of this kind and their use. The present example belongs to his Cyp2 group, copying Mycenaean pottery shapes, with parallels from Dromolaxia, Enkomi, Kalavasos-Mangia, and Maroni, along with several unprovenanced examples. Bibliography: Bevan A. 2007, Stone vessels and values in the Bronze Age Mediterranean (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press).
